title: Sustained findings since 2017

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Sustained findings since 2017
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Under the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, N.J.S.A. 47:1A-1 et seq., I am requesting copies of records related to cases of sustained findings of police misconduct at the Newark Police Internal Affairs, between 2017 and 2022. This includes, but is not limited to, documents, reports, multimedia, body-worn camera footage, arrest filings, and so on. It also includes all documents, notes, correspondence and memoranda evidencing sustained findings reports and investigations, and all communication and correspondence in whatever tangible medium between the officials, the victims and the overseeing agency. 

I am requesting digital copies of all responsive documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Here, misconduct includes, but is not limited to:

Excessive (unreasonable) force – beatings, manhandling of people in handcuffs, improper use of Tasers, injuries inflicted by police dogs, improper use of deadly force, and other police brutality or disregard for the safety of suspects. It also includes, but is not limited to: physical and verbal abuse, restraints happening unreasonably, coerced or forced confessions, and sexual abuse and assault. 

False arrests – pulling over, detention, questioning and searches conducted without any probable cause whatsoever, including cases of planted evidence, racial profiling and trumped-up charges of resisting arrest.

As of March 2022, public officials must release police disciplinary records in New Jersey when the public’s interest in them outweighs an officer’s confidentiality concerns, the state’s top court ruled. 

The law requires that you respond to and fulfill this request "as promptly as possible."  If you expect a significant delay in responding to and fulfilling this request, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
 
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Should you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me at 415-769-8210 or ananyatiwarijournalism@gmail.com.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ananya Tiwari

title: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Pepsi and Coke (University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.

- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.

- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

I Look forward to your request within 5 business days

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kayla Henson

title: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like to learn: 1) which local, state and national law enforcement agencies can currently submit probe photos to be run through the Colorado Department of Motor Vehicles face recognition system and, 2) which law enforcement agencies actually submitted probe photos from January 1, 2020 to the date of the most recently available data.

Please provide any lists, logs or datasets showing this information.  With regard to agencies that have submitted probe photos, please provide logs, lists or datasets describing, as available, the requesting organization, the number of requests made, the dates of the requests, and the number of requests granted.  If the Department maintains this information in an Excel spreadsheet, I request that the record be produced in this format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Tepper

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Tepper:

We are writing in response to your Colorado Open Records Act request.  Your
request involves records that cannot be reasonably gathered, reviewed and
prepared within the three-day period without substantially interfering with
the custodian’s obligation to perform her other public services.
Accordingly, pursuant to C.R.S. 24-72- 203 (3) (b)(III), we will be taking
up to an additional seven working days to complete your request.
Regards,
Patrick Harton

*CORA Manager*
[image: co_dor_edo_rgb_Email_Sig.png (400Ã—77)]
www.colorado.gov/revenue/cora

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Law Enforcement Agencies Accessing Colorado DMV's Face Recognition System
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Tepper:

We are writing in response to your Colorado Open Records Act ("CORA")
request. Per the DMV, the Department accepts a submitted photo from any law
enforcement agency but only for the purposes of assisting with an active
criminal investigation, and except for the purposes of immigration
enforcement. See C.R.S. 42-1-206. Please see the attached documents for the
requested data.
Regards,
Patrick Harton

*CORA Manager*
[image: co_dor_edo_rgb_Email_Sig.png (400Ã—77)]
www.colorado.gov/revenue/cora

title: Meta-FOIA for DHS Processing of Katie Miller née Waldman’s Family Separation Communications - 2019-01265

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Meta-FOIA for DHS Processing of Katie Miller née Waldman’s Family Separation Communications - 2019-01265
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

On behalf of the #DetentionKills project on Al Otro Lado, I hereby request: 

1. all records created by the DHS FOIA-Privacy Office in response to FOIA request 2019-01265, which the Department acknowledged receiving in September 2019 and allegedly tasked components for searching in October 2019. 

2. Any written policy or procedure substantiating Senior FOIA Specialist Maura Bausch’s statement that information about the processing of this request could only be conveyed by phone — and not in writing 

3. All records of communication regarding any follow-up by the DHS FOIA office with the requestor regarding this request. 

4. Any record reflecting DHS efforts to clear its backlog through the processing of this request in the ordinary course of its operations.  

5. Any tasker from the DHS FOIA Office to any federal agency component pertaining to this request - 2019-01265. 

Because the Department is currently breaking the law and violating the requestor’s due process rights in its handling of the 2019 Waldman Family Separation Comms request, and because these records pertain to the court-recognized violation of rights of separated parents and children which fall in the hierarchy of genocidal acts nation-states engage in, and because this particular official’s role in the family separation crimes committed has been the subject of significant media attention and public interest, I respectfully request expedited processing of this request and certify under 28 USC 1746 that the foregoing statements of fact are true and correct. 

An adequate search will task all FOIA processors, including Maura, and their records of communication regarding this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

title: Kentucky DJJ Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Kentucky DJJ Youth Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc).

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department/office or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

title: MOU Sunshine law request

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MOU Sunshine law request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to obtain copies of public records to include the Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) between the St. Louis County Parks Department and the St. Louis County Police Department that describes the pay and duties of the St. Louis County Police Lieutenant detached to the Parks Department to oversee the Park Rangers for the years of 2017 to 2021. Please include any and all email correspondence that touches on the MOU arrangement in any way.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how public funds are being used to replace the Parks Department leadership with Police Department leadership and relay the information to include a cost analysis to the public by way of a news media report. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

The Missouri Sunshine Law requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this time period, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.

If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beth Flowers

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Hillsborough Community College)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (Hillsborough Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Puyallup School District  – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Puyallup School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply email and destroy all copies of the original message.

---

On Nov. 4, 2021:
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Puyallup School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Puyallup School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record.

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

View request history, see one related attachment, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fpuyallup-school-district-24536%252Fpuyallup-school-district-request-for-a-complete-electronic-copy-of-all-public-records-requests-received-by-the-district-including-district-responses-for-the-years-2015-2021-120944%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicrecords%252540puyallup.k12.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAEh3NUBNXQtivDnsWNRI6OhLoI%3A1oHUUY%3AVb-6NK25tnkESluOrb0XN2wPb342XnNjDPWGaqJRUAQ

If prompted for a passcode, please enter:
PJHCCWHC

On Nov. 4, 2021:
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Puyallup School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Puyallup School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record.

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

On Nov. 4, 2021:
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Puyallup School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Puyallup School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record.

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

On Nov. 4, 2021:
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Puyallup School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2015 - 2021
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the Puyallup School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record.

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

title: Report Footnote Records

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Report Footnote Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All releasable Board of Correction records -- including memoranda, letters, and emails -- related to footnote 4 in the Board of Correction's October 24, 2022, report, titled "Recent Trends in Lockdowns in New York City Department of Correction Facilities."

The footnote reads: "There is some indication that the Department may be underreporting the incidence of emergency lock-ins, despite DOC policy that requires lock-ins to be reported to the Department’s Central Operations Desk (COD). See NEW YORK CITY DEP’T OF CORRECTION, DIRECTIVE NO. 4009 R-C, LOCK-IN / LOCK-OUT (eff. date 10/2/20). For instance, during an unannounced visit to GRVC in June 2022, Board staff came upon a General Population (GP) housing unit that clearly was locked down. Correction officers assigned to that area explained to Board staff that the unit was on lockdown due to insufficient uniformed staffing. The next day, Board staff reviewed the Central Operations Desk (COD)-generated 24-Hour Report for the date of that visit and was unable to locate a report in connection with that lockdown."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Response Added to FOIL-2022-073-00028 - File
communications.communication:
Re: Freedom of Information Law Request Response Chris Gelardi 
This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law request to the NYC Board of Correction received January 4, 2023. You requested the following information: “All releasable Board of Correction records…related to footnote 4 in the Board of Correction's October 24, 2022, report, titled "Recent Trends in Lockdowns in New York City Department of Correction Facilities." 
A diligent search for records responsive to your request located 1 related document.

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 837-t Delinquincy Notices
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All delinquency notices sent from DCJS to local departments/agencies regarding failure to comply with Executive Law 837-t, the use of force data collection law that was signed by the governor in April 2019.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 837-t Delinquincy Notices
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Geraldi:



This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by the Division of Criminal Justice Services on January 25, 2023. The request was for "All delinquency notices sent from DCJS to local departments/agencies regarding failure to comply with Executive Law 837-t, the use of force data collection law that was signed by the governor in April 2019.".



Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.



A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 20 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.



Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.







Very truly yours,




Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

I hope are all well. If possible, I would like to amend this FOIL request.

Instead of: "All delinquency notices sent from DCJS to local departments/agencies regarding failure to comply with Executive Law 837-t, the use of force data collection law that was signed by the governor in April 2019."

Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: FW: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: 837-t Delinquincy Notices
communications.communication:
Dear Chris Gelardi:

This is in response to your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request to the Division of Criminal Justice Services ("Division") for "Any and all lists of agencies deemed to have been delinquent in their reporting requirements under Executive Law section 837-t (Use of force reporting) as of the end of each calendar year since the law was enacted. I also request any record of wording in delinquency notices sent to said agencies."

Please find attached a .pdf that contains a list of delinquent agencies and a .pdf that is a sample delinquency notice that is sent to agencies when they are delinquent in submitting Use of Force Reports to the Division.  Please note that the list was generated on 2/14/2023.  A report submitted by an agency after the list was generated would not be reflected on the list.  Within the list of delinquent agencies, a Y indicates the agency submitted the report for that month. The agency may have submitted "Nothing to Report" or may have submitted Use of Force incidents. The N indicates that the agency did not submit the Use of Force report to DCJS for that month.

Pursuant to POL §89(4)(a), you may appeal this determination within 30 days to the Counsel, Division of Criminal Justice Services, 80 South Swan St., Albany, NY 12210 or by email at foil@dcjs.ny.gov<mailto:foil@dcjs.ny.gov>.

Very truly yours,

Brian Garvey, Esq.
Records Access Officer

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following California Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 31, 2023. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Attorneys’ Oaths of Office (The State Bar Of California)
communications.communication:
Dear Mark Ritchie,

Thank you for your patience.

The State Bar is in the process of assessing whether it has any documents responsive to your request. We anticipate having a final response by Wednesday, February 15.

Please note, however, that attorneys licensed in California are not required by law to carry malpractice/professional liability insurance. There is no central depository for this type of information, and the State Bar does not collect or maintain it. As such, we do not have any records responsive to the bond portion of your request.

The State Bar does require that attorneys disclose to clients in most instances if they do NOT carry malpractice insurance. 

Please see Rule 1.4.2 of the California Rules of Professional Conduct<https://gcc02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.calbar.ca.gov%2FPortals%2F0%2Fdocuments%2Frules%2FNew-Rules-of-Professional-Conduct-1.pdf&data=05%7C01%7Cpra%40calbar.ca.gov%7C44d58ea160354c37d57a08daa0fd4953%7C25577ba53ebd4ec590d70e8148a8318a%7C0%7C0%7C637999306972803596%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UFJN4tB7qjyvWbOYvPDJPB7%2FtFMDENXvKAMHPDSVabk%3D&reserved=0> for details of when and how this applies.

Best regards,

Public Records Coordinator
The State Bar of California<http://www.calbar.ca.gov/> | 845 S. Figueroa St. | Los Angeles, CA 90017
pra@calbar.ca.gov<mailto:pra@calbar.ca.gov>

Working to protect the public in support of the mission of the State Bar of California.
Please consider the environment before printing this email.

We have entered their name, bar number, and date of admission directly over the copy of the oath card that each submitted for admission. The bar number was assigned after the oath card was received and the attorney was admitted to the State Bar.



Manuel Vazquez, Cal. BAR No. 295576

Michael Raymond Sew Hoy, Cal. BAR No. 243391

Gary Y. Leung, Cal. BAR No. 302928



Our customary charge for certification of a record is $10.00.  If you require certified copies of the attached three records, kindly mail your request and a check for $30.00 payable to ‘The State Bar of California’, to the attention of:


Louise Turner

The State Bar of California

Office of Attorney Regulation

180 Howard Street

San Francisco, CA 94105



The oath cards of the remaining two licensees on your list are maintained by the Supreme Court of California, not by the State Bar of California, and the State Bar has no copies to provide:



Roberto A. Tercero, Cal. BAR No. 143760
Michele W. Layne, Cal. BAR No. 118395



Sincerely,


--

Ph: 888.800.3400 | Fax: 415.538.2576 | AttorneyRegulation@calbar.ca.gov<mailto:AttorneyRegulation@calbar.ca.gov>

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Clark County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Gaggle alerts

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Gaggle alerts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident reports, alerts, notifications, and any other materials containing the term “Gaggle” or related to Gaggle-generated alerts. Materials responsive to this request would be all records related to an alert from the Gaggle system, a platform used to monitor student activity online and on school-provided devices. Materials may have come directly from the Gaggle platform or from a school or a school representative. 
 
If you have any questions about this request or are unsure of the platform or type of materials I am requesting, please contact me, and I would be happy to provide additional clarification.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Beryl Lipton

There are also emails that potentially have confidential student information. Please specify whether you are seeking emails and what type of emails you are seeking. I am releasing three emails as an example of what we have. This may help you to clarify what you are seeking. Pursuant to Texas Government Code Section 552.222(d) If by the 61st day after the date a governmental body send a written request for clarification or discussion under Subsection (b) or an officer for public information or agent sends a written request for additional Information under Subsection (c) the governmental body, officer for public information, or agent, as applicable, does not receive a written response from the requester, the underlying request for public information is considered to have been withdrawn by the requester.   Upon receipt of your clarification, we will gladly process your request and provide you with an estimate, if applicable.   ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? communications.subject: FOIA Request - MUCKROCK NEWS
communications.communication:
MUCKROCK NEWS
The University of the District of Columbia is in receipt of your request for :
"A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits)  awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola , or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company. If the contract was cancelled, any and all material related to its cancellation. If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the University about cancellation."

This constitutes an acknowledgement of your initial request to this office and not a determination of the availability or accessibility of any records. Please feel free to reach out if you have further questions. This request was made via e-mail in reliance on the District of Columbia Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), DC Code § 2-531 et seq on February 2, 2023. All public bodies are required to respond to a FOIA request within 15 business-days (that is, excluding Saturdays, Sundays and legal public holidays). Public bodies may extend the time for a response by an additional 10 business-days (again, excluding Saturdays, Sundays and legal public holidays) for unusual circumstances, as defined by DC Code § 2-532 (d). Thank you for contacting the University of the District of Columbia.


Thomas E. Redmond
Assistant General Counsel
Office of the General Counsel
University of the District of Columbia
Bldg. 39, Ste. 301Q-3
Direct: 202-274-5622
Email: tredmond@udc.edu<mailto:tredmond@udc.edu>

www.udc.edu<http://www.udc.edu/>


Intellection + Connectedness + Learner + Analytical + Harmony



This message and any attached documents contain information which may be confidential, subject to privilege or exempt disclosure under applicable law. These materials are intended only for the use of the intended recipient. Delivery of this message to any person other than the intended recipient shall not compromise or waive such confidentiality, privilege or exemption from disclosure as to this communication.

communications.subject: FOIA Request -
communications.communication:
Muckrock News:

Please see attached the University's response to your February 2, 2023 UDC FOIA request. You requested:

"A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits)  awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola , or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company. If the contract was cancelled, any and all material related to its cancellation. If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the University about cancellation."

Attached is the responsive contract to your inquiry.   If you find this response to your record request to be unsatisfactory, then you are entitled to file an appeal pursuant to D.C. Code § 2-537 and 1 DCMR § 412 to the Mayor or to the Superior Court of the District of Columbia. If you elect to appeal to the Mayor, your appeal must be in writing and contain "Freedom of Information Act Appeal" or "FOIA Appeal" in the subject line of the letter as well as on the outside of the envelope. The appeal must include (1) a copy of the original request; (2) a copy of any written denial; (3) a statement of the circumstances, reasons and/or arguments advanced in support of disclosure; and (4) a daytime telephone number, an e-mail and/or U.S. mailing address at which you can be reached.

The appeal must be mailed to: The Mayor's Office of Legal Counsel (MOLC), FOIA Appeal, 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 407, Washington, D.C. 20004. Electronic versions of the same information can be e-mailed to foia.appeals@dc.gov. Further, a copy of all appeal materials must be forwarded to the FOIA Officer of the involved agency --- here, the University of the District of Columbia.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me.


Thomas E. Redmond

title: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (South Florida State College)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (South Florida State College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any records reflecting or documenting action by your institution as a result of, or intended to satisfy, the commitments made in the January 18, 2023, "Florida College System Presidents Statement on Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Critical Race Theory," available at https://www.fldoe.org/core/fileparse.php/5673/urlt/FCSDEIstatement.pdf.  This request includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, emails, directives, instructions, or guidance issued to administrators, staff, faculty, or employees concerning the January 18 statement. It also includes, but is not limited to, any calendar entries concerning the January 18 statement. 

2. Any communications to or from the president or provost of your institution (including, but not limited to, memoranda, emails, text messages, or social media messages) concerning the January 18 statement.

3. Any records (including correspondence) sent to the provided in response to Memo No. 23-021, sent on December 28, 2022 by Chris Spencer, Director of the Office of Policy and Budget, directing each institution of higher education to provide certain information by Friday, January 13, 2023.

Please note that this request does not seek a search of faculty or student email accounts or records. These requests should in no way be construed to include a review or search of email accounts, websites, or other forms of data or document retention which are controlled by students, alumni, or faculty members, nor by governmental or advisory bodies controlled by the same, except insofar as any such individuals also serve in an administrative capacity and the records were created or are held by the individual in that capacity. Any search should be limited to documents held by the administration and/or its staff members, including records created or maintained by persons acting in the capacity of administrators or staff members.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: PRR# 2023-02  RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida College Presidents' Pledge to Stop 'Critical Race Theory' (South Florida State College)
communications.communication:
Mr. Steinbaugh

Your request for documents is considered a request for copies of the College’s public records pursuant to F.S. Chapter 119.  Please let this email serve as the College’s formal acknowledgment of your public records request under F.S. §119.07(1)(c).  Your request has been assigned number 2023-02.  As required by law, the College will make reasonable efforts to determine whether responsive records to your request exist and will finalize your request within a reasonable time.  This may require examination of responsive records for exempt or confidential and exempt information and redaction of any statutorily protected material.  F.S. §119.07(4) authorizes the College to charge fees for providing duplicated copies of public records or providing extensive clerical or IT assistance in processing your request.

I will be in touch with you soon to let you know (a) when you can expect the documents to be ready and (b) whether you can expect any charges for the College’s records services.

Let me know if you have any questions.

Peter

Peter

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police Staff Roster (February 2023) (Sumner Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Milkshake the Cow

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Milkshake the Cow
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear AMS:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. I am requesting records related to AMS's mascot, Milkshake the Cow.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

(A) All records related to the conception of and process of designing the Milkshake mascot (emails and other correspondence, memoranda, contracts, sketches, etc.)

(B) Records sufficient to answer the following questions:

(1) Whose idea was it to create an AMs mascot in the first place, and why?

(2) Who designed the Milkshake mascot, and what was the design process like? (e.g. were there multiple design concepts submitted? Was the design of the character contracted out? (If so, kindly produce the contract).

(3) Were any Milkshake-related promotional items or tchotchkes created (e.g trading cards, coloring books)? If so, please produce them.

(4) Were there any life-size Milkshake costumes created? If so, please produce records related to the design of the costume (contracts, sketches, etc.) and any guidelines regarding the use of or care for the costume.

(5) Did anyone in Congress ever object to AMS's use of a mascot? I understand that there have been periodic attempts by lawmakers (e.g. former Oklahoma senator Tom Coburn) to rein in agency spending on mascots. If so, please produce all records related to that.

(6) What has the public's reaction been to the Milkshake mascot?

(7) Is AMS still using Milkshake as part of its public outreach? If not, why not?

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: FOIA 2022-AMS-00193-F Acknowledgement and Fee Waiver Determination
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Marritz,

This email confirms receipt of your attached FOIA request.  Your request was received in the USDA Agricultural Marketing Service (AMS) FOIA Office on September 6, 2022 and assigned tracking number 2022-AMS-00193-F.  Please reference this number in any future communications with our office regarding your request.

Pursuant to the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), AMS has 20 business days upon receipt of your request to make a determination.  In unusual circumstances, such as the need to search for and collect records from field offices, the need to examine a voluminous amount of records, or the need to consult with another agency, AMS can extend the 20-day time limit for processing a request.  AMS generally processes FOIA requests on a "first-in/first-out" basis; however, the actual processing time will depend upon the complexity of your request, including whether it involves sensitive or voluminous records, business submitter records, extensive searches, and/or multiple consultations both within and outside of the Agency.

In addition to your request for records, you asked that we waive all fees associated with processing your request.  As a requester, you bear the burden under the FOIA of showing that the fee waiver requirements have been met.  Based on our review of your request and the reasons stated, we have determined that your fee waiver request does sufficiently meet all of the criteria under the FOIA and the applicable regulations; therefore, your request for a fee waiver is approved.

We will comply with your request to the fullest extent permissible by law.  Any records not subject to an exemption will be forwarded to you promptly upon completion of AMS' search and review process.

If you have any questions regarding the status of your request, please contact Kyla Niedermaier-Betts, Government Information Specialist, at (202) 961-5298 or by email at kyla.niedermaier-betts1@usda.gov<mailto:kyla.niedermaier-betts1@usda.gov>.

Thank you,

Heather Higgs
Government Information Specialist
FOIA Office
Agricultural Marketing Service
U.S. Department of Agriculture
Bozeman, Montana
Office/Cell:  (202) 641-8684

Any unauthorized interception of this message or the use or disclosure of the information it contains may violate the law and subject the violator to civil or criminal penalties. If you believe you have received this message in error, please notify the sender and delete the email immediately.

title: MuckRock emails (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: MuckRock emails (Department of Health and Human Services)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all emails containing the terms "MuckRock", "Muck Rock" or "MuckRock.com", excluding emails sent to or from a MuckRock.com email address. Please include the complete email exchange for each email, including any emails that are being replied to as well as any subsequent replies.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities. I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the Internet Archive and MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media. 

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category. As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Emma Best

communications.subject: HHS FOIA Request 2019-00953-FOIA-OS
communications.communication:
Case No.2019-00953-FOIA-OS September 09, 2021 Emma Best 
Journalist 
MuckRock.com 
DEPT MR 54994 
411A Highland Avenue 
Somerville, MA  02144-2516 Dear Ms. Best: This office is presently conducting a review of our pendingFreedom of Information Act (FOIA) requests to ascertain if the information subjectto the request is still desired. YourMay 30, 2019 FOIA request is a part of this review (copy enclosed).  We apologize for the delay in responding to yourrequest. However, because of theincreasing number of requests received by the Department of Health & HumanServices, we found it necessary to adopt the ruling in the case of OpenAmerica v. Watergate Special Prosecution Force, 547 F.2d 605 (D.C. Cir.1976) and exercise due diligence by following a first-in, first-out FOIAprocessing. If you are still interested in pursuing this request, pleaserespond to this e-mail and we will complete the processing of your request. If we have not received any communication from you within 30working days from the date of this communication, we will assume you are no longerinterested in continuing to pursue the request and it will be administrativelyclosed. For further information concerning this matter, please contactEmily Blitzer, Government Information Specialist, at Emily.Blitzer@HHS.gov. (mailto:Emily.Blitzer@HHS.gov) Sincerely yours, Arianne Perkins Director, Initials FOIA Requests FOI/Privacy Acts Division

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Rhode Island Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

Hello and thank you for your email. If you are making a Freedom of Information Act request to the University of South Carolina, please visit our FOIA request public portal: https://universityofsouthcarolina.justfoia.com/publicportal/home/newrequest. 

All new requests should begin at that page, so we recommend that you bookmark the link for easy access. Once you submit through the portal, you will receive a confirmation from that system.

 
Thank you and have a great day!

communications.communication:
RE: FOIA Request Request Number: FR-2023-38 Submitted on: 1/25/2023 at 4:10:54 am 
  
 Dear Kayla Henson 
  
 This is in response to the Freedom of Information Act request that you recently directed to the University of South Carolina. The University has determined that it possesses documents that are responsive to your request. However, the University anticipates that some of the responsive documents, or portions of them, may be exempt from disclosure under the Act.? 
  
 The University will make the non-exempt documents that are responsive to your request available to you as soon as reasonably possible. 
  
 Please be advised that obtaining or using public records for commercial solicitation directed to any person in this State is prohibited. A person who knowingly violates this prohibition is guilty of a misdemeanor and, upon conviction, must be fined an amount not to exceed five hundred dollars or imprisoned for a term not to exceed one year, or both. S.C. Code Ann. §30-2-50. 
  
 Please contact us if you have any questions in connection with the foregoing.? 
  
 
Shannon Beaudry
FOIA Coordinator

University of South Carolina

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the { Michigan Freedom of Information Act. }, I hereby request the following records:

- A copy of any and all contracts (including associated amendments and exhibits) awarded to Pepsi, Coca-Cola, or any subdivision thereof, for the provision of beverages or other goods in any facilities under the purview of this organization, including all activities and buildings associated with athletics, sports, dining services, or otherwise. If this agency does not have a contract with either of the named companies, please provide the equivalent agreement with the currently employed company.
- If the contract(s) was cancelled, any and all materials related to its cancellation.
- If the contract was cancelled, the statement from the university about cancellation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within { 5 days }.

Sincerely,

{ Kayla Henson }

Dear Kayla Henson,

I am writing in regard to your Freedom of Information Act request dated January 23, 2023, which was received on January 24, 2023.

Due to the large number of requests currently being processed by this office, it will not be possible to respond to your request within the five-day period accorded by the Michigan Freedom of Information Act. However, under Section 5 (2) (d) of the Act, the University is permitted to extend the deadline for not more than 10 business days beyond the initial due date.

The University will respond to your request on or before February 14, 2023.

Thank you,

Carolyn

title: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tuberculosis case notification data and related policies, 2000-2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington Public Records Act Request: Tuberculosis case notification data and related policies, 2000-2022
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:


*  Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020-July 2022.
* Records of date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases.
* Records ofTB treatment outcomes for all notified cases. 
* Records of number of and location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested and date of testing.
* Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all WA state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020-July 2022.
* Records of number of and location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested.
* Any and all WDOC policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons.
* Records of movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prisons reporting TB cases from January 2020-July 2022, including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason of transfer, origin prison, and destination prison.

For all items, we are requesting de-identified records.


The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. Further, we respectfully request a waiver of these fees as we are affiliated with a research institution, and this request is made for a scholarly or scientific purpose and not for a commercial use. We would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Katharine Walter

communications.subject: Public Records Request, P-29139
communications.communication:
Ms. Walter:

I acknowledge receipt of your public records request dated July 18, 2022 and received in our office on July 19, 2022. We have assigned this request a tracking number of P-29139.  Please reference this number in all future communications regarding this request.

You state your request to be for the following records:

1.      Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020‐July 2022
2.      Records of date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases
3.      Records of TB treatment outcomes for all notified cases
4.      Records of number of and location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested and date of testing
5.      Records of TB case notifications in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all WA state prisons, with day and institution of notification for each case from January 2020‐July 2022
6.      Records of number of and location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested
7.      Any and all WDOC policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons
8.      Records of movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prisons reporting TB cases from January 2020‐July 2022, including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason of transfer, origin prison, and destination prison

I interpret your request to be for disclosure of the following records:

1.      Records showing TB case notifications from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022 (the date your request was received) in all Washington state prisons, including date and facility location
2.      Records showing date of TB treatment initiation for all notified cases
3.      Records showing all TB treatment outcomes for all notified cases
4.      Records showing number of, and facility location of incarcerated individuals offered TB testing including number of individuals who were tested and date of testing
5.      Records showing TB case notifications from the time frame of January 1, 2020, to July 19, 2022 (the date your request was received) in all Washington state prisons for corrections officers in all Washington state prisons, including date and facility location
6.      Records showing number of, and facility location of corrections officers offered TB testing and number of individuals who were tested
7.      Any and all current g Washington State Department of Corrections policies and procedures regarding TB prevention and control measures put in place in prisons
8.      Records showing movements of incarcerated individuals from or to any of the prison facilities reporting TB cases during the time frame of January 1, 2020 to July 19 2022, (the date your request was received) including the number of individuals transferred, date of transfer, reason for transfer, origin facility, and receiving facility

I will begin by determining what if any of this information exists outside of confidential individual health records and gather what is available outside of these protected records.   I anticipate being able to provide you an installment of records within 46 business days, on or before August 29, 2022. If you have any questions in the interim, please contact me at tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov<mailto:tonja.monroe@doc1.wa.gov>.

Sincerely,

Tonja Monroe, Public Records Specialist
Public Records Unit
Washington State Department of Corrections
PO Box 41118
Olympia WA 98504-1118

Rose Terse
